result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricki Daniel Ugalde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Ricki Daniel Ugalde appeared by phone.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for Sheboygan, County of. 
State is going to dismiss this case.  The DE plead guilty on case 22CM364 and this case should have been dismissed at that time but it was not called.  State will submit order.
Review scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Ricki Daniel Ugalde appeared by phone.  Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe in court for Ricki Daniel Ugalde.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights on file.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. 
State: Count 1 - $150 fine +costs and Count 2 - DRI - joint recommendation.
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 1 - Court finds Deft Guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 is Dismissed and Read in.
State makes sentencing argument. 
Atty LaCombe requests Court to follow joint recommendation.
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court follows joint recommendation and orders $150.00 fine +costs with a payment plan of $50.00/month commencing 10/01/2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
